medical_history.chief_complaint: Bilateral pheochromocytoma diagnosed at age 31 and medullary thyroid carcinoma diagnosed 6 years later.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented at age 31 with severe headache, hypertension (170/100 mm Hg), tachycardia (100 bpm), and deteriorating general condition, leading to a suspicion of pheochromocytoma. Six years later, at age 37, a thyroid ultrasound revealed a 5 mm thyroid nodule and elevated calcitonin levels, indicating medullary thyroid carcinoma.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Previous diagnosis of bilateral pheochromocytoma at age 31 and medullary thyroid carcinoma at age 37. No relevant past medical conditions specified.
medical_history.family_history: No family history of medullary thyroid carcinoma, pheochromocytoma, or primary hyperparathyroidism. The RET mutation is a de novo mutation.
